thread.title: Karen Gillan reassures fans about revealing 'Jumanji' costume
thread.title_full: Karen Gillan reassures fans about revealing 'Jumanji' costume

author: USA TODAY
title: Karen Gillan reassures fans about revealing 'Jumanji' costume
text:
Karen Gillan reassures fans about revealing 'Jumanji' costume Kelly Lawler , USA TODAY 11:33 a.m. ET Jan. 23, 2017 28 Shares 
When the first official photo from the upcoming reboot of Jumanji hit the Internet -- which will star The Rock, Kevin Hart, Jack Black and Karen Gillan -- fans noticed something a little off with Gillan's costume. A photo posted by therock (@therock) on Sep 20, 2016 at 8:29am PDT 
Some pointed out that Gillan's character was wearing a significantly revealing and sexualized outfit, especially compared to her male co-stars. But in a recent interview with The Hollywood Reporter , Gillan explained that the photo doesn't tell the full story. 
“I’ve experienced something similar when I worked on Doctor Who and there was such an uproar about my costume when that was first revealed, so I thought it was happening all over again,” she told THR . 
Early photos of Gillan on Doctor Who -- where she played companion Amy Pond from 2010-2013 -- showed her in a British police uniform with a very short skirt, which drew criticism. In the actual show it was revealed she wasn't a police officer but rather a "kiss-o-gram." 
Gillan went on to say that the Jumanji costume also has a deeper meaning. 
“But I have to say, I’d never take on a role that was truly gratuitous for no reason." she said. "There’s a really valid reason why she’s wearing that. My character is really not happy about it!” Jumanji! Yes I'm wearing child sized clothes and YES there is a reason! The pay off is worth it, I promise! #Jumanji pic.twitter.com/qBshnhwV6K — Karen Gillan (@karengillan) September 21, 2016 
The film is set to hit theaters Dec. 22. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2jQZ2Ia Most Popular
